cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi (490 km) south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: turning north-northwest tonight, then slowing and moving northwest toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near the Intracoastal City–Morgan City area

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Intracoastal City, LA to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River, MS
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast from the central Texas coast eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Outer rainbands could bring occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (up to 40 mph) late Tuesday into Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Galveston given west-of-track position and weak onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of intermittent squally rain possible Tuesday night–Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along the Upper Texas coast.
